thread.title: ASX 200: Australian superannuation funds the most bullish on stocks in over a decade as cash supplies dwindle
thread.title_full: ASX 200: Australian superannuation funds the most bullish on stocks in over a decade as cash supplies dwindle

author: Alex Gluyas
title: ASX 200: Australian superannuation funds the most bullish on stocks in over a decade as cash supplies dwindle
text:
Markets Equity Markets Sharemarket Print article Super funds drain cash piles to go all-in on frothy markets
Alex Gluyas Markets reporter Jan 10, 2025 – 1.24pm
Save Log in or Subscribe to save article

The Australian super industry’s dwindling cash supplies and ballooning exposure to the US sharemarket could leave the nation’s multitrillion-dollar retirement pool at risk if the two-year bull rally that’s pushed equities sky-high levels suddenly reverses.
That’s according to new research from MST Marquee, which found institutional super funds – which control around $3 trillion of Australia’s $4.1 trillion pension pool – were the most bullish on stock markets they’ve been in more than a decade, and are positioning for another round of big gains this year.
Loading... Alex Gluyas is a markets reporter based in our Melbourne newsroom. Connect with Alex on Twitter . Email Alex at alex.gluyas@afr.com
